A system built solely on GET and POST is not at variance
with REST, at least not merely on that criterion.

Walden

----- Original Message -----
From: "Josh Knowles" <josh.knowles@...>
To: <rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 24, 2003 8:00 PM
Subject: [rest-discuss] REST and HTML forms


> Anyone have any tips, or good links, to best practices for integrating a
> HTML front end to a REST system.  For example if I remember correctly
> HTML forms can only submit POST and GET requests, so if the system is
> set up to use PUT and DELETE do I have to put in a intermediary to do
> the translation or is there a JavaScript trick that I haven't seen yet?
>
> Thanks,
>
> Josh
